intro: Carlina simplex, commonly known as the common cudweed, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in the summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Carlina simplex is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a pioneer species in ecological succession.
